verses.name: Proverbs 23:1
verses.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

verses.name: Proverbs 23:2
verses.text: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:3
verses.text: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:4
verses.text: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:5
verses.text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:6
verses.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

verses.name: Proverbs 23:7
verses.text: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:8
verses.text: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:9
verses.text: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:10
verses.text: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

verses.name: Proverbs 23:11
verses.text: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:12
verses.text: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:13
verses.text: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:14
verses.text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:15
verses.text: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:16
verses.text: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:17
verses.text: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the Lord all the day long.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:18
verses.text: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:19
verses.text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:20
verses.text: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

verses.name: Proverbs 23:21
verses.text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:22
verses.text: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:23
verses.text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:24
verses.text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:25
verses.text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:26
verses.text: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:27
verses.text: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:28
verses.text: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:29
verses.text: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

verses.name: Proverbs 23:30
verses.text: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:31
verses.text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:32
verses.text: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:33
verses.text: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:34
verses.text: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:35
verses.text: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
